content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is the code to implement this:
```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")  # split into words
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result)*length(word)+len(word)-2 > text_width
            result *= "\n" * word
        elseif isempty(result)
            result *= word
        else
            result *= " " * word
        end
    end
    return result
end

println(wrap_string("This is a long sentence that should be wrapped"))
```
In this example, the string will be broken into smaller chunks when its length exceeds `text_width`. If `text_width` isn't provided as an argument to `wrap_string`, it defaults to 10.
